item.title: Try automating Qiita's likes monitoring with Lambda+DynamoDB+CloudWatch
item.description: This article is a relay of "[2020 New Year Advent Calendar TechConnect!](https://qiita.com/dgkz/items/5131349d56354b33ee97)"of[LinkInformationSystem](https://www.lis.co.jp/) This is an article. TechConnect! is a self-starting advent calendar relayed by a self-made group called engineer.hanzomon. (From the link information system Facebook here) This article is for Wednesday, January 15th on the 7th day. Past articleI’mdoingit,butitwaslikeapersoninchargeofcountingthenumberoflikesofouradcurry.(Ididnotwritetheadadarebeforethat,butIcollectitbyshellart) Well, if you want to automate it anyway, if you notify it like a Qiita milestone when the number exceeds a certain amount ~~ It will be fun ~~ I decided to let it run with AWS Lambda.

item.title: Championships that like each other within the organization with Advent Calendar (code only)
item.description: #Introduction By the way, Advent Calendar is also full of excitement, personally VIPorstockAIItwasamonththatIenjoyedit.Ididn’tbuzzatall,butIreallylikeEmployee2vec. Now that I have finished my job, I am writing an article while drinking a highball and thinking about the next topic. I usually focus on machine learning and computer vision, but once in a while, it’s a good idea to make something you like, with the pure taste when you start programming like this. ・ ・ ・

item.title: After hitting the Qiita API with Python to get a list of articles for beginners, we will worship God articles
item.description: ## Introduction Qiita’s “Beginner” tag and “New Programmer Support” tag articles for beginners As a new QA engineer, everything is very helpful. Unfortunately, the individual tag page only shows trends and new articles, The specifications make it difficult to find good articles in the past. In this article, first use the Qiita API to write an article for beginners (:= Article with the tag “Beginner” OR “Newcomer programmer support”) After creating a program to output all, next read each article in the output list in descending order of likes I would like to introduce the God articles that I felt “This is really helpful!

item.title: [Qiita API] Get Views, Likes, Stocks in various ways (JavaScript, Google Script, Python, Vue.js)
item.description: ## Introduction Looking at my post on Qiita, I see three numbers: “Page view”, “Like” and “Stock”. I like the “likes” of all posts on my page, but I don’t know the View and Stock of each post or the total. Since I have about 20 posts, I decided to try various methods to get all of my posts, views, likes, and stocks for studying. When I looked it up, everyone hit the Qiita API in various ways to obtain information, and there are many reference pages, so I will carry out it while checking them.
